subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "Who is he that overcometh the world, but he that believeth that Jesus is the Son of God." (I Jn. 5:5)
reflection: Christ spoke strongly of the world hating Him. His kingdom and the kingdom of this world are in hostility with one another. John understood the lesson and summed it up in these words."We know that we are of God and the whole world lieth in wickedness." "Love not the world, nor the things that are of the world." "If any man love the world, the love of the Father is not in Him." The world still exerts a terrible influence over the Christian who does not know that in Christ he has been crucified to the world. In the pleasure in eating and drinking, in the love and enjoyment of what there is to be seen of its glory, and in all that constitutes the pride of life. the power of this world proves itself. Most Christians are either utterly ignorant of the danger of a worldly spirit or feel themselves utterly powerless to conquer it. But Christ has left us a great promise: "Be of good cheer, I have overcome the world." So take the time to ask yourself whether you believe with your whole heart in the victory that faith gives over the world. Put your trust in the mighty power of God, in the abiding presence of Jesus as the only pledge of certain and continual victory.
prayer: Pray for a life entirely possessed by the faith of Jesus to maintain the victor's attitude at all times. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: On one occasion, while He was eating with them, He gave this command: "Do not leave Jerusalem, but wait for the gift My Father promised, which you have heard Me speak about. For John baptized with water, but in a few days you will be baptized with the Holy Spirit." (Acts 1:4-5)
reflection: After our Lord had given the command: "Go into all the world and preach the Gospel to every creature, " He again added another, His very last command: "Wait till you receive the power from above." "Wait for the promise of the Father." "You will be baptized with the Holy Spirit." All Christians agree that the great command to preach the Gospel to every creature was not only for the disciples but is binding on us too. But it seems that all do not appear to consider that the very last command, not to preach until they had received the power from on high is equally binding on us as it was on the disciples. The Church appears to have lost possession of that which ought to be to her a secret of secrets ~ the abiding consciousness, day by day, that it is only as she lives in the power of the Holy Spirit that she can preach the Gospel in demonstration of the Spirit and of power. So let us seek earnestly the grace of the Holy Spirit, who alone can Himself reveal to us what eye hath not seen, nor ear heard, nor hath entered into the heart of man to conceive ~ the things which God hath done and loves to do for them that wait upon Him.
prayer: Let us fervently pray for the power of the Holy Spirit. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "God hath made that same Jesus, whom you have crucified, both Lord and Christ." (Acts 2:36)
reflection: This our King is the crucified Jesus. God has place Him in the midst of His throne as a lamb, as it has been slain, and so all the hosts of heaven adore Him ~ and so we worship Him as a King. Christ's cross is His highest glory. It is through this, that He has conquered every enemy and gained His place on the throne of God. AND it is this that He will impart to us too if we are to know fully what the victory over sin is to mean. When Paul wrote: "I have been crucified with Christ, Christ liveth in me, " he taught us that it was the crucified One and that Christ ruled on the throne of his heart and that the spirit of the cross would triumph over us as it did in Him. So let us surrender our will, and the entire self-denial of our old nature, so that we can become the worthy servants of a crucified King, and so that our hearts become worthy temples of His glory.
prayer: Lord make me a worthy servant and my heart a worthy temple of Your glory. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "Being assembled with them, He charged them not to depart from Jerusalem to wait for the promise of the Father." (Acts 1:4)
reflection: If we would truly understand the outpouring of the Holy Spirit's answer to the prayer of the disciples, we must ask: What was there in these men that qualified them for such power, effectual prayer and the wonderful fulfillment of the promise that came to them??? Lets remember they were simple, unlearned men with many faults, but whom the Lord had called to forsake all and follow Him. And oh yes we must also remember, They had done this, as far as they could: they followed Him in the life He led and the work He did. Oh yes like us there was much sin in them and they had as yet no power to fully deny themselves, but at the same time their hearts clung to Him in deep sincerity. Even in the midst of much stumbling they still followed Him to the cross. They shared with Him His death; unconsciously but most really, they died with Him to sin and were raised with Him in the power of new life. Let this be the test by which we try ourselves whether we have indeed surrendered to the fellowship of Christ's suffering and death, and whether we have hated our old life and crucified it ~ and have received the power of Christ's life in us.
prayer: Lord make me a willing learner in the school of Jesus, seeking above everything else that intimate fellowship with Him. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "They are not of this world even as I am not of the world." (Jn. 17:14, 16)
reflection: In His last night our Lord took pains to make clear to His disciples the impassable gulf between Him and the world and between them and the world too (Jn. 16:16-21). He had said of the Spirit: "The world cannot receive Him, because it seeth not, neither knoweth Him." "Because ye are not of the world, therefore the world hateth you." One great mark of the disciples was to live so little as the world, that they become one with Christ. They both belonged to another world, the Kingdom of heaven. This separation from the world is to be the mark of everyone who is filled with the Spirit.
prayer: Help me day by day to pick up my cross to follow you. As You are not of this world, even-so help me to put aside worldly things. Amen.

subject: THOUGHTS TO LIVE BY
verse: "Ye shall be baptized with the Holy Spirit." (Acts 1:5) "Ye shall receive power when the Holy Spirit is come upon you." *Acts 1:8)
reflection: The third mark of the Church ~ the power for service through the Holy Spirit. Since the time of Adam's fall when he lost the spirit God had breath into him, God's Spirit had striven with people, and worked in some with power, BUT He had never been able to find His permanent home in them. It was only when Christ had come and by His death had broken the power of sin and had won in the resurrection a new life for all to live in Himself, that the Spirit of God could come and take possession of the whole heart and make it a dwelling place for Christ and for God. The Spirit now reveals Christ in us as first of all our life and then our strength for a perfect obedience and the preaching of the Word in the power of God. Amazing mystery! The Spirit of God, our life; the Spirit of Christ, our light and strength. It is as men and women who are led by this Spirit of the first disciples, that we shall have the power to pray the effectual prayer of the righteous that availeth much.
prayer: Dear Father we thank You for Your Holy Spirit who descends to live with-in believers to take possession of them as God's Holy temple. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "Ye shall be my witnesses" (Acts 1:8)
reflection: A mark of Christ's Church is ~ His servants are witnesses to Him, ever testifying of His wonderful love, of His power to redeem, of His continual abiding presence, and of His wonderful power in them. This is the only weapon that the King allows His redeemed ones to use. Without claiming authority or power, without wisdom or eloquence, without influence or position, each one is called, not only by his words but by his life and action ~ to be a living proof and witness of what Jesus can do. This is the only weapon they are to use in conquering souls and bringing them to the feet of Christ. Here we have the secret of a flourishing Church: every believer a witness for Jesus. Here we have the cause of weakness of the Church: so few who are willing in daily life to testify that Jesus is Lord.
prayer: Lord teaches us one and all about the blessedness of so knowing Jesus and the power of His love, that we may find our highest joy in witnessing to what He is and has done in us. Amen.

subject: Thoughts to live by
verse: "The Spirit of truth, shall testify of Me, and You shall also bear witness, because you have been with Me from the beginning." (Jn. 15:26-27)
reflection: "My witness ~ not only refers to all pastors, but also every believer. This is a high calling and also the only power of the preacher of the Gospel ~ in everything a pastor is to be a witness for Jesus. This gives us two truths. the first, that with all that the preacher teaches from the Word of God or according to the need of the congregation, he must first of all place the preaching of Christ Himself ahead of all else. This is what the disciples did. The minister of the Gospel may never forget that it is for this specially that he has been set apart, to be with the Holy Spirit a witness for Christ. But there is a second thought which isn't any less important. And that is, that the teaching must always be a personal testimony from experience to what Christ is and can do. It is precisely this that will build up believers so that they can walk in such fellowship with Jesus Christ that He can reveal Himself through them.
prayer: Pray for such a sensitivity to the Holy Spirit's leading that the abundance of the Spirit would go forth from your mouth praising and giving glory to our blessed Redeemer, Jesus Christ or Lord. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "When the Holy Spirit has come upon you, you will receive power, and will tell people about Me everywhere". (Acts 1:8)
reflection: 'The Power from the Holy Spirit' is not limited beyond the ordinary. That power also involves courage, boldness, confidence, insight, ability, and authority. The disciples would need all these gifts to fulfill their mission. If you believe in Jesus Christ as your Savior, you can experience the power of the Holy Spirit in your life. Jesus promised the disciples that they would receive power to witness after they received the Holy Spirit. Notice the progression: (1) They would receive the Holy Spirit, (2) He would give them power, and (3) They would witness with extraordinary results. Often we try to reverse the order and witness by our own power and authority. Witnessing is not showing what we do for God. It is showing and telling what God has done for us.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, help me to believe that in answer to prayer, the crucified Jesus will do far more than I can ask or think. Amen.

verse: Make every effort to keep the unity of the Spirit through the bond of peace. ~ There is one body and one Spirit, just as you were called to one hope when you were called. (Eph. 4:3-4)
reflection: It is from Paul that we learn how the Christian communities in different place ought to remember each other in the fellowship of prayer. In the times in which we live there is a great need that we as children of God throughout the world be drawn closer together in the consciousness of their being chosen by God to be a holy priesthood ministering continually in the sacrifice of praise and prayer. All believers in Christ belong to one body; all are united under one head, Christ Himself. Each believer has received God-given abilities that can strengthen the whole body. Your special ability may seem small it may even be large, but it is yours to use in God's service. So ask God to use your unique gifts to contribute to the strengthening and health of the body of believers.
prayer: Lord, I thank You that I can be a part of the body of believers, help me to recognize my full potential by using the gifts you have given me. Help me to realize the blessedness of being one in heart and spirit with your people. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: After they prayed, the place where they were meeting was shaken, and they were filled with the Holy Spirit and they spoke the word of God boldly. ~ All the believers were one in heart and mind. (Acts 4:31~32a)
reflection: Today we are attacked on every side ~ Big business are folding up, there are influenza scares, tourist scares, contaminated food scares, gun control scares, our retirements or savings will be lost, the list goes on and on. It's enough to make one just cover up his head and stay in bed. We need more boldness. ~ Boldness is not reckless impulsiveness. Boldness requires courage to press on through our fears and do what we know is right. ~ So the important question is 'how can we become bold??? Like the disciple, we need to pray with others for that courage. To gain boldness, you can (1) pray for the power of the Holy Spirit to give you courage, (2) look for opportunities in your family and neighborhood to talk about Christ, (3) realize that rejection, social discomfort, and embarrassment are not necessarily persecution, and (4) start where you are by being bolder in small ways. Satin would have us to be all entangled with the things of the world, so that he can draw our attention away from the things of God. Oh yes differences of opinion are inevitable among human personalities and at times can actually be helpful if handled well. But spiritual unity is essential ~ loyalty, commitment, and love for God and His Word. Without unity, the Christian Church as we know it will be over come and we will go the way of Satin.
prayer: Lord Jesus, help us to become one again unified in the Word give us boldness to share what You have done, and can do for those who will believe. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "Our Father who art in heaven" (Lk. 11:2)
reflection: How simple, how beautiful, this invocation which Christ puts upon our lips! And yet how inconceivably rich in its meaning, in the fullness of the love and blessing it contains. What a gift Christ bestowed on us when He gave us the right to say "Father!" "The Father of Christ, " "Our Father, " "My Father." And then, "Our Father in heaven, " our heavenly Father. We should count it as a privilege as we bow in worship to know that the Father comes near to us where we are upon the earth. As we gather up our thoughts of what fatherhood on earth has meant and hear the voice of Christ saying: "How much more" we begen to feel the distance there is between the earthly picture and the heavenly reality, then and only then can we bow in lowly, loving adoration. Then and only then can we feel the full joy and power come to us as we rest rejoicing in the words: "How much more shall your heavenly Father give the Holy Spirit to them that ask Him?"
prayer: Drear Heavenly Father, Help me to live in such a way that my life would show that I am a part of the family of God. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "The effectual fervent prayer of a righteous man availeth much" (James 5:16)
reflection: Prayer availeth much. It avails much with God. It avails much in the history of His Church and people. Prayer is the one great power which the Church can exercise in securing the working of God's omnipotence in the world."The effectual fervent prayer of a righteous man availeth much." It is only when the righteous man stirs up himself and rouses his whole being to take hold of God that the prayer availeth much. As Jacob said: "I will not let thee go"; as the importunate widow gave the judge no rest, so it is that the effectual fervent prayer effects great things When two or three agree, there is the promise of an answer. Think of how much when hundreds and thousands unite with one objective to cry to God to display His Mighty power on behalf of His people.
prayer: Dear heavenly Father, may we all join those who have united themselves to call upon thee for the mighty power of Your Holy Spirit in Your Church. Let each of Your people pray individually and united for the grace of the effectual fervent prayer which availeth much. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "He that searcheth the hearts knoweth what is the mind of the Spirit, because He maketh intercession for the saints according to the Will of God." (Ro 8:27)
reflection: What a light these words cast upon the life of prayer in the hearts of Christians. We know not what we should pray for or as we ought. How often this hinders our prayer or hinders the faith that is essential to its success. But here for our encouragement we are told, that the Holy Spirit "maketh intercession" for us with groanings that cannot be uttered."He maketh intercession for the saints according to the Will of God." What a prospect is opened here for us! Where and how does the Spirit make intercession for the saints? In no other way than that, in the heart which knows not what to pray, He secretly and effectually prays what is according to the Will of God. This of course implies that we trust Him to do His work in us and that we remain before God even when we know what to pray, in the assurance that the Holy Spirit is praying for us. What a difference it would make in the life of many of God's saints if they realized this!
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, Help us to separate ourselves from the world. Help us to yield ourselves wholeheartedly to the leading of the Spirit within us, deepen all our thoughts or expectations. Help us to surrender ourselves completely to You. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "With all prayer and supplication, praying at all seasons in the Spirit, and watching thereunto in all perseverance and supplication for all the saints and on my behalf." (Eph, 6:18-17) R. V.
reflection: I think that Paul had a deep sense of divine unity of the whole body of Christ and of the actual need of unceasing prayer for all the members of the body by all who belong to it. AND He did not mean this to be an occasional thing, but the unceasing exercise of a life long union in which we are bound together, should be evident from the words he uses, "with all prayer and supplication, praying at all seasons in the spirit and watching thereunto, in all perseverance and supplication for all the saints." He expects believers to be filled with the consciousness of the being in Christ and through Him united consciously to the whole body, that in our daily life and all its engagements, our highest aim would always be the welfare of the body of Christ of which we are members. So as children of God let us live for Christ our King.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, help me to live in a willingness of sacrifice of prayer and intercession at all times and for all saints! Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "Continue in prayer. and watch in the same with thanksgiving, withal praying also for us." (Col. 4:2-3)
reflection: Prayer for all saints: let this be our first thought. It will need time and thought and love to realize what is included in that simple expression. Think of your own neighborhood and all the saints you know; think of our whole country and praise God for all who are His saints; think of all Christian nations of the world and the saints to be found in each of these; think of all the heathen nations and the saints of God to be found among them in ever-increasing numbers. Think of all the different circumstances and conditions in which these are to be found and all the varying needs which call for God's grace and help. Think of the many, oh, so many, who are God's saints and yet through ignorance or sloth, through worldly-mindedness or an evil heart of unbelief are walking in the dark and bringing no honor to God. Think of so many who are in earnest and yet conscious of a life of failure, with little or no power to please God or to bless man. And then think again of those who are found everywhere, in solitary places or in companies, whose one aim is to serve the Lord who bought them to be the light of those around them. This is not the work of one day or one night. It needs a heart which will set itself from time to time to do serious thinking in regard to the state and the need of the body of Christ to which we all belong.
prayer: Pray daily for the love of God and Christ to fill our hearts ~ and ~ for the power of the Holy Spirit to come down and accomplish His work in this sinful world. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "Give us day by day our daily bread." (Lk. 11:3)
reflection: There are many Christians who are afraid of the thoughts of a promise to pray every day as being far beyond their capability. They feel that they could not uphold this promise ~ but yet they pray to God to give them their bread day by day. If the children of God once yielded themselves with their whole lives to God's love and service, they should count it a privilege to avail themselves of any invitation that would help them every day to come into God's Presence with the great need of His Church and Kingdom. Are there not many who confess that they desire to live wholly for God? Are there not many who acknowledge that Christ gave Himself for them? Are there not many who say that In His love He watches over them and works in them without ceasing? And aren't there many that admit that nothing less than the measure of the love of Christ to us should be the measure of our love to Him? Don't they also feel that this ought to be the standard of their life? If this be true, shouldn't they welcome every opportunity for proving day by day that they are devoting their heart's strength to the interest of Christ's Kingdom and to the prayer that can bring down God's blessing? To those who have to confess that they have not totally understood the high privilege and the solemn duty of waiting on God in prayer for His blessing on the world should now welcome the invitation.
prayer: Enlarge my vision to include daily united prayer for all of Your children and all the work of Your Kingdom. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "They were all with one accord in one place. and they were all filled with the Holy Spirit." (Acts 2:1, 4)
reflection: Our last chapters opened up to us wonderful thoughts of the solidarity of the whole body of Christ and the need to cultivate the slumbering or buried talents of intercession. We need to thank God, for we know of the tens of thousands of His children who in daily prayer are pleading for some portion of the work of God's kingdom in which they are personally interested. But in many cases there is a lack of that large-hearted and universal love that takes up all the saints of God and their service into His embrace. There is not the boldness and the strength that comes from the consciousness of being part of a large and conquering army under the leadership of our conquering King. The thought to remember is: The power of each individual member is increased to a large degree by the inspiration of fellowship with a large and conquering host. Nothing can help us to an ever-larger faith as the consciousness of being one body and one spirit in Christ Jesus.
prayer: Let us pray that we would always be mindful that united prayer brings the answer to prayer. Amen.
